Description: Bronze figure of Isis wearing the sun-disc with horns(one incomplete) with a uraeiform modius and vulture-headdress; gilded eyes; suckling figure of Harpocrates wearing the double-crown with a side-lock; no throne; beneath the feet of Isis is a plinth with a tang below.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.12 (misnumbered EA 1129).
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2009 Apr-present, Swaffham Museum, Egyptian Gallery, LT Loan
